content: front needle and one stitch from the back needle onto the third needle to close the tube and form a flat edge 66 stitches are now on one needle we will now work 3-stitch icords across the flat edge 1 knit the first 3 stitches on the needle 2 slip stitches from the right needle back to the left needle repeat steps 1 and 2 a total of 30 times to make icords that measure 5 in / 12 5 cm break yarn and weave in ends attach yarn at the base of the scarf and work another icord over the next 3 stitches continue to knit icords across the scarf until no live stitches remain tip i used a cordsmith to make my icords this is optional but it s a quick and efficient way to create consistent cords see this tutorial amy brucker 2026 @aimzstitches 4 yarn tip if you d like to use all of your yarn weigh the amount used for the fringe on the first edge i used approximately 12 g reserve 15 g for the second fringe and use the remaining yarn for the stockinette body make the fringe on the live edge using a spare needle slip one stitch from the front needle and one stitch from the back needle across to close the tube and create a flat live edge 66 stitches are now on one needle close the live stitches in the same manner as the cast-on edge before beginning the i-cord fringe weave in all ends block gently to the desired measurements and lay flat to dry amy brucker 2026 @aimzstitches 5 happy knitting i d love to see what you make tag me on instagram @aimzstitches and use the hashtag #snowbirdsnugglescarf amy brucker 2026 @aimzstitches
